amendment.description: Amendment sought to require the Secretary of Defense to ensure that every tactical missile program of the Department of Defense that uses solid propellant as the primary propulsion system shall have at least two fully certified rocket motor suppliers in the event that one of the rocket motor suppliers is outside the national technology and industrial base.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 10 printed in Part B of House Report 114-569 to require the Secretary of Defense to ensure that every tactical missile program of the Department of Defense that uses solid propellant as the primary propulsion system shall have at least two fully certified rocket motor suppliers in the event that one of the rocket motor suppliers is outside the national technology and industrial base.

vote.text: On agreeing to the McKinley amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 211 - 213 (Roll no. 203).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the McKinley amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 211 - 213 (Roll no. 203).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A005) offered by Mr. McKinley.
